posts.title: Bookkeeping
posts.content: Bookkeeping is the process of recording, classififying, and organizing a company's financial transactions.

posts.title: Bookkeeper
posts.content: A bookkeeper is a financial professional who plays a vital role in maintaining the accuracy and organization of a company's financial records.

posts.title: Accounts Receivable
posts.content: Accounts receivable (AR), abbreviated as A/R sometimes, represent the money owed to a business by its customers for goods or services that have been delivered but not yet paid for.

posts.title: Accounts Payable
posts.content: Accounts payable (AP), sometimes abbreviated as A/P, refers to the short-term debt a business owes to its suppliers for goods or services that have been received but not yet paid for.

posts.title: Journal entry
posts.content: A journal entry is the fundamental record of a financial transaction in accounting.

posts.title: General ledger
posts.content: A general ledger is a comprehensive record of all the financial transactions of a company.

posts.title: Trial balance
posts.content: A trial balance in accounting is like a giant checklist to ensure everything is balanced in the company's books.

posts.title: Account reconciliation
posts.content: Account reconciliation in accounting is like double-checking your piggy bank to make sure everything adds up.

posts.title: English
posts.content: English is a West Germanic language that originated from the Anglo-Frisian dialects brought to Britain by Germanic invaders from what is now northwestern Germany, southern Denmark and the Netherlands.

posts.title: The English Language
posts.content: The English language is like a giant toolbox filled with words and grammar rules that you can use to communicate with people all over the world! It's a way of speaking, writing, listening, and reading that lets you share your ideas, thoughts, and stories with others.

posts.title: English Teacher
posts.content: An English teacher is your personal guide on the incredible journey of learning English! They're there to support you every step of the way as you develop your skills in all areas of the language.

posts.title: Adverb
posts.content: An adverb in English is a word that adds more details to verbs (action words), adjectives (describing words), or even other adverbs!

posts.title: Verb
posts.content: A verb in English is an action word! It tells you what someone or something is doing, or what happens.

posts.title: Adjective
posts.content: An adjective in English is a describing word! It helps you tell more about the nouns (people, places, things) in your sentence.

posts.title: Noun
posts.content: A noun in English is a word that names a person, place, thing, or idea.

posts.title: Pronunciation
posts.content: Pronunciation in English is like your personal secret code for how to sound out words. It's all about understanding how those squiggly letters we see on the page translate into the sounds we say when we speak.

posts.title: IPA
posts.content: IPA, which stands for International Phonetic Alphabet, is like a secret code used by linguists to capture the unique sounds that make up every word in any language, including English.
